title: Formatter: JUnit XML output
description: Implement JUnitFormatter that buffers results and writes standard JUnit XML on on_run_finish. Map features to testsuites, scenarios to testcases. Include failure messages and timing.

title: Refactor execution pipeline: parse-once discovery with in-memory feature cache
description:
## Problem

The current execution pipeline parses feature files multiple times:

1. **Codegen phase** (`codegen.mbt:151`): Parses each `.feature` file to extract structure for test generation
2. **Runtime phase** (`feature.mbt:7,13`): Re-parses the same content during test execution:
   - `FeatureSource::Text(str)` → parses embedded string again
   - `FeatureSource::File(path)` → re-reads from disk and parses again
3. **PerScenario codegen mode** (`codegen.mbt:292-314`): Embeds the entire feature file content as a multiline string literal in EACH generated test — so a feature with 10 scenarios has the full feature text duplicated 10 times in the generated code
4. **Parallel execution** (`parallel.mbt`): Each parallel async task independently parses its input with no shared cache

## Research: How Cucumber Frameworks Handle This

All major cucumber frameworks (cucumber-js, behave, cucumber-rs) follow the same pattern:

```
Discovery → Parse Once → [In-Memory Representation] → Filter → Execute → Report
```

### Key principles:
- **Parse once, execute from memory**: Feature files are parsed exactly once during an upfront discovery phase. The parsed representation is the sole input to execution.
- **Separation of parsing from execution**: Parsing produces an intermediate representation (Pickles in cucumber-js, Feature model objects in behave, Feature structs in cucumber-rs). The executor never touches raw Gherkin text.
- **Example expansion before execution**: Scenario Outlines are expanded into concrete scenarios before execution begins.
- **Step matching at execution time**: Step definitions are resolved during execution, not during parsing.

### Framework-specific approaches:
- **cucumber-js**: `loadSources()` discovers + parses all features → Pickle Compiler flattens into execution-ready Pickles → Runtime iterates Pickles
- **behave**: `collect_feature_locations()` discovers → `parse_features()` groups by filename and parses each unique file once → `self.features` list is iterated by `run_model()`
- **cucumber-rs**: `Basic` parser globs for features → `gherkin::Feature::parse_path()` + `.expand_examples()` → async Stream consumed once by Runner

## Proposed Solution

Refactor the moonspec execution pipeline to follow the standard cucumber architecture:

### Phase 1: Discovery
- Add a `discover_features(paths: Array[String]) -> Array[String]` function that walks directories and collects `.feature` file paths
- Support glob patterns for flexible discovery

### Phase 2: Parse Once + Cache
- Add a `FeatureCache` type (essentially `Map[String, @gherkin.Feature]` keyed by file path)
- Parse each discovered feature file exactly once into the cache
- Expand Scenario Outlines at parse time (already partially done in `scenario_outline.mbt`)

### Phase 3: Execution from Cache
- Modify the runner to accept `FeatureCache` (or `Array[@gherkin.Feature]`) instead of `Array[FeatureSource]`
- Remove `FeatureSource::Text` and `FeatureSource::File` variants (or deprecate them)
- Default to `FeatureSource::Parsed` path which skips re-parsing
- Parallel execution shares the same parsed cache (read-only)

### Phase 4: Codegen Alignment
- Codegen should emit `FeatureSource::Parsed(...)` or reference the cache
- Stop embedding full feature text as string literals in generated test files
- Instead, generate code that references the pre-parsed feature from the cache

## Files Affected
- `moonspec/src/runner/feature.mbt` — `resolve_feature()` and `execute_feature_filtered()`
- `moonspec/src/runner/run.mbt` — Entry points `run`, `run_with_hooks`
- `moonspec/src/runner/parallel.mbt` — Parallel execution
- `moonspec/src/runner/results.mbt` — `FeatureSource` enum definition
- `moonspec/src/codegen/codegen.mbt` — Test file generation
- `moonspec/src/cmd/main/main.mbt` — CLI commands (discovery integration)
- New file: `moonspec/src/runner/cache.mbt` or `moonspec/src/runner/discovery.mbt`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Feature files are parsed exactly once per test run
- [ ] In-memory cache/collection holds parsed Features for the duration of execution
- [ ] Parallel execution shares parsed features (no re-parsing per task)
- [ ] Generated test files no longer embed full feature content as strings
- [ ] Existing tests continue to pass
- [ ] `FeatureSource::Parsed` is the primary execution path

title: Codegen: Generate _test.mbt from .feature files
description: Implement generate() that reads .feature files via moonrockz/gherkin, produces _test.mbt files with one test block per scenario. Include staleness detection via source hash in header comment. Handle Scenario Outline expansion into individual test blocks.

title: Runner: Result types
description: Define StepStatus (Passed, Failed, Skipped, Undefined, Pending), StepResult, ScenarioResult, FeatureResult, RunResult, RunSummary. These are consumed by formatters.

title: Runner: Parallel scenario execution
description: Support running scenarios concurrently when config.parallel is true. Each scenario gets its own World instance so there are no shared state issues. Collect results from all scenarios.

title: Formatter: Pretty console output
description: Implement PrettyFormatter with colored, indented console output. Show pass/fail markers, step durations, error details for failures, skipped step indicators, and summary counts at the end.

title: Formatter: Cucumber Messages NDJSON output
description: Implement MessagesFormatter that maps runner events to cucumber-messages Envelope types and writes NDJSON. Uses moonrockz/cucumber-messages package. Enables integration with Cucumber ecosystem tools.

title: Runner API: moonspec.run convenience function
description: Implement the top-level run() function for use inside test blocks: moonspec.run!(MyWorld::new(), path). Parses features, creates runner with default config and pretty formatter, executes, raises on failure.

title: Core: Hooks trait
description: Define the Hooks trait with before_scenario, after_scenario, before_step, after_step methods. All have default no-op implementations. Define ScenarioInfo and StepInfo types.

title: Runner: Scenario Outline expansion
description: Expand Scenario Outlines with Examples tables into concrete scenarios before execution. Each Examples row produces one scenario with placeholder values substituted. Generate unique test names including parameter values.

title: Runner: Dry-run mode
description: When config.dry_run is true, validate step bindings without executing handlers. Report undefined steps (no matching expression) and pending steps. Useful for checking feature file coverage.

title: Runner: Scenario executor and lifecycle
description: Implement Runner struct parameterized on World+Steps+Hooks. Implement scenario lifecycle: create world, register steps, run before_scenario hook, execute each step (match via cucumber-expressions, extract params, call handler), run after hooks. On step failure, skip remaining steps.

title: CLI: moonspec command with subcommands
description: Implement CLI entry point with subcommands: run (parse+execute), gen (generate _test.mbt files), check (dry-run validation), list (list scenarios with optional tag filter), fmt (format .feature files). Global options: --features, --tags, --format, --no-color.

title: Runner: Tag expression parser and filtering
description: Implement TagExpression::parse() for boolean tag expressions: @tag, not @tag, @a and @b, @a or @b, parenthesized groups. Implement TagExpression::matches(tags) for filtering scenarios.

title: Project scaffolding: moon.mod.json, package structure, README
description: Initialize the MoonBit project with moon.mod.json (name: moonrockz/moonspec), create package directories (src/core, src/runner, src/format, src/codegen, src/cmd/main), moon.pkg.json files for each package with correct dependencies, .gitignore, and CLAUDE.md.

title: Formatter: Formatter trait
description: Define the Formatter trait with event-driven methods: on_run_start, on_feature_start, on_scenario_start, on_step_finish, on_scenario_finish, on_feature_finish, on_run_finish. Runner notifies all registered formatters as events occur.

title: Core: World and Steps traits
description: Define the World trait (new() -> Self), Steps trait (steps(Self, StepRegistry) -> Unit), StepRegistry struct with given/when/then methods, StepHandler type, and StepArg enum (IntArg, FloatArg, StringArg, WordArg, CustomArg).
